The Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA), in support of the Aviation Division (SG), has a requirement for commercial Airborne Imaging Systems (AIS) and Mission Equipment to be installed on existing Government-owned and operated aircraft.

Solicitation Title: Request for Interested Manufacturers of the UH-1N Internal Rescue Hoist
Description Text:
SUBJECT:

Market research is being conducted to identify potential sources that may possess the expertise, capabilities, and experience to meet the requirements for qualification and production of the Internal Rescue Hoist. PR# FD2060-25-00058.

ITEM DESCRIPTION

The UH-1N Internal Rescue Hoist Model 42305-3 is an upgraded Model -1, internally mounted, electrically powered hoist that utilizes an industry-unique translating drum cable management system with patented cable tension and Weston braking systems. translating drum technology allows for unlimited fleet angle and duty cycle. The lubricated cable management system extends cable life and resists corrosion on internal metal components. Current applications include Bell 205, 210, 212, 214, 412, Huey II, UH-1H and UH-1N/Y.

IMPEDIMENT TO COMPETITION

The original component manufacturer for this item is Goodrich Corporation (CAGE Code: 3HRL4), which was developed specifically for the UH-1N helicopter program. The Government does not own any data, drawings, schematics, or any other releasable technical data in support of this requirement. As a result, Goodrich Corporation, is the only known source with adequate knowledge of the Internal Rescue Hoist performance requirements and possession of the required technical data and capabilities needed to produce this item and ensure compatibility of the equipment.

INTEREST

The DLA/AWB Contracting Office intends to award a sole source contract to Goodrich Corporation for the purchase of Internal Rescue Hoist in support of the UH-1N helicopter program.  Other interested parties may identify their interest and capability to respond to the requirement no later than 04 October 2024 by emailing Kiem Tarpley (kiem.tarpley@us.af.mil) and/or Vanessa Moes (vanessa.moes.1@us.af.mil). The Government intends to procure these items using Other Than Full and Open Competition as prescribed by FAR 6.302-1, Only One Responsible Source and No Other Supplies or Services Will Satisfy Agency Requirements.

DISCLAIMER

This sources sought synopsis is for informational purposes only. This is not a request for proposal.  It does not constitute a solicitation, and shall not be construed as a commitment by the government.   Responses in any form are not offers, and the government is under no obligation to award a contract as a result of this announcement.  No funds are available to pay for preparation of responses to this announcement.   Any information submitted by respondents to this technical description is strictly voluntary.

Description Text:
The Department of Energy/Western Area Power Administration (WAPA) intends to negotiate on a single source basis with Bell Textron Inc. of Fort Worth, TX under the authority of FAR 13.106-1(b)(2), Soliciting From a Single Source, for the purchase of one (1) new Bell 407 GXi aircraft.



The Government intends to acquire these services using the provisions, clauses, and procedures prescribed in FAR Part 12 and FAR Part 13, specifically FAR Part 13.5 Simplified Procedures for Certain Commercial Items.



This is a sole-source requirement to Bell Textron Inc as WAPAs current fleet of four (4) helicopters are all Bell 407 models. Purchase of another Bell model 407 to phase out an existing aging aircraft will enable economies of scale in both flight maintenance, operation, and provisioning (i.e., spare parts and equipment) for the aircraft and training and utilization of the pilots. Procuring a different helicopter other than a Bell 407 will cause increased costs to the agency in spare parts and inventory as well as other logistical issues concerning requiring another manufacturers service center for maintenance requirements.



The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for this acquisition is 336411, and the size standard is 1,500 employees. It is anticipated this action will result in a firm-fixed-price contract with Bell Textron Inc on or about September 15, 2021. Delivery and acceptance is anticipated to take place at origin six (6) months after contract award at the manufacturers facility in Piney Flats, TN.

The units need helicopter specific enhancements and need to be able to visualize flight plans including departures, arrivals, visual/GPS approaches & holding procedures.   The units need overlays for potential hazards such as terrain, weather (including NEXRAD, METARs, TAFs, winds & temps aloft, PIREPs & NOTAMs) & traffic on a rich map for enhanced situational awareness on at least 4.9” touch screen.  The units will also need to interface with existing avionics and autopilots.  The units need a fully certified VHF communication radio that can provide at least a standard 10 watt of power output with the ability to decode a stations Morse code to provide a positive ID.  Night vision version is not required.  Helicopters have adequate panel area for the installation and an approved location for the antenna.

NOTE: This Request for Quotation (RFQ) is a continuation of pre-solicitation notice # 89503020QWA000049 and has been renumbered to 89503020QWA000050 due to system issues.



The Department of Energy/Western Area Power Administration (WAPA) has a requirement for Centralized Helicopter Maintenance Services for its fleet of Bell 407 helicopters. The successful contractor shall furnish all labor, supervision, facilities, materials, equipment, tools, emergency repairs and supplies necessary to provide Centralized Helicopter Maintenance Services including but not limited to the scheduled major inspections, overhauls, major alterations, major repairs, unscheduled major inspections, scheduled inspections, and annual inspections on WAPAs four Helicopters and their components. This includes the time between overhaul (TBO) inspections and replacement of retirement life items listed under the following type certificates: H2SW and E1GL, with latest revisions. WAPA operates the following four Bell Helicopter Model 407 aircraft:



Registration #N617DE, Serial #53867 (based at Loveland, CO),

Registration #N618DE, Serial #53798 (based at Bismarck, ND),

Registration #N619DE, Serial #53410 (based at Phoenix, AZ),

Registration #N620DE, Serial #53885 (based at Chico, CA),



The Government intends to acquire commercial items and services using the provisions, clauses, and procedures prescribed in FAR Part 12 and FAR Part 13, pursuant to the authority provided under FAR Subpart 13.5, Simplified Procedures for Certain Commercial Items.



This requirement has been 100% set-aside for small business concerns. The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) is 488190 and the size standard is $35.0 million. Solicitation Title: Commercial Bell 407 Helicopters in support of the MQ-8 Fire Scout Unmanned Aircraft System (UAS)
Description Text:
The Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIR), NAS Patuxent River, MD, intends to negotiate and award Firm Fixed Price commercial contract actions to Bell Helicopter Textron, Inc. (BHTI), Fort Worth, TX for the procurement of the following items: Up to an additional ten (10) Bell 407 variant commercial helicopters, associated Bell 407 unique components, support equipment,  preservation and storage, and engineering support through FY 2021. These contract efforts are in support of the Government Furnished Equipment (GFE) requirements under the MQ-8C Fire Scout Unmanned Air System (UAS) Program of Record (POR) with Northrop Grumman Corporation (NGC) which authorizes a quantity up to forty (40) MQ-8C Fire Scout Air Vehicles through FY 2022. 
The proposed contract action(s) are those for which the Government intends to solicit and negotiate with only one source under the authority of 10 U.S.C.2304(c)(1) and FAR 6.302-1, "Only One Responsible Source and No Other Type of Supplies or Services will Satisfy Agency Requirements." BHTI is the original equipment manufacturer (OEM) of the commercial Bell 407 helicopter selected by NGC for inclusion in the MQ-8C Fire Scout System design. The US Government has since broken the airframe out as GFE. It is the only known airframe configuration that meets the minimum requirements in support of existing production of the MQ-8C Fire Scout. BHTI is the sole designer, developer, and manufacturer of the commercial Bell 407, and therefore is the only contractor with the requisite knowledge, experience, and technical data that can meet the Government's GFE airframe requirements on a timely basis and in a cost effective manner.
